intro: Irlbachia paruana, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Irlbachia paruana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid forest understories.
